intro: Oxypetalum pallidum, commonly known as the pale oxypetalum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Oxypetalum pallidum is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
